alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN BRACKEN AND CENTRAL PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 729 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Falmouth, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Falmouth, Brooksville, Morgan, Browning Corner, Neave, Milford, Berlin, Powersville, Kincaid Lake State Park, Catawba, Gene Snyder Airport, Petra, Mckinneysburg and Santa Fe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
